revised_title: Molecular Genetics of Sry and its Role in Mammalian Sex Determination
tldr: The article discusses the molecular genetics of the Sry gene and its role in mammalian sex determination. It explains how the Sry gene, present on the Y chromosome, determines whether an embryo develops as male or female by triggering the testicular pathway. The author also examines the expression of Sry during critical stages of genital ridge development and its interaction with DNA through an HMG box DNA binding domain.
